TUMOUR_ID.description: Project specific ID for each tumour. As someone can have more than one tumour a patient can have multiple unique tumour IDs.

AGE.description: Age of the patient when they were diagnosed with the tumour in years.

ICD_CODE.description: Describes site of origin of the neoplasm.

ICD_CODE_3CHAR.description: £ character that describes site of origin of the neoplasm.

MORPH_CODE.description: Morphology of the cancer, in the ICD-10-O2 system

HISTOLOGY_CODE.description: Histology code - combines the morphology and behaviour codes.

enumDescriptions: GX : Grade of differentiation is not appropriate or cannot be assessed

NODES_TOTAL.description: The number of local and regional nodes reported as being positive.

NODES_POSITIVE.description: The number of local and regional nodes examined.

STAGE.description: Best stage derived using T, N, and M Stage

ER_STATUS.description: Oestrogen receptor status of the tumour

PR_STATUS.description: Progesterone receptor status of the tumour

HER2_STATUS.description: Human Epidermal Growth Factor Receptor 2 (HER2) status of the tumour

Ki67.description: Ki67 % Positive nuclei as indicated in report

SCREEN_DETECTED.description: Whether or not the tumour was detected by a screening programme.

LATERALITY.description: Identifies the side of the body for a tumour relating to paired organs within a patient, based on the evidence from a pathological examination. The data field is used to differentiate tumours in paired organs (and define the site of the pathology/cytology specimen).

EXCISION_MARGIN.description: An indication of whether the surgical excision margin finding was clear of the tumour and if so, by how much.
enumDescriptions: 1 : Excision margins are clear (distance from margin not stated)
2 : Excision margins are clear (tumour >5mm from the margin)
3 : Excision margins are clear (tumour >1mm but less than or equal to 5mm from the margin
4 : Tumour is less than or equal to 1mm from excision margin, but does not reach margin

N_STAGE.description: How far the tumour has grown through local tissues and distant spread of disease with involvement of lymph nodes.

SOURCE.description: Source of the tumour entry in the table

DATE_CREATED.description: Date record created in the table
